attributes.Title: Papermaking with Local Plants
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Art Studio
267
Mount Holyoke College
In addition to learning basic paper chemistry in this course, students collect usable sections of a variety of plants wherever they live throughout the summer and in the Pioneer Valley in the fall during the course.  These plants are examined and recorded before and after drying, then cooked and processed to become paper pulp. Students conceive and construct their art projects inspired by the historical, biological, ecological, and personal aspects of plants as well as their physical qualities.
Prereq: At least one 200-level studio art course.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
93238

attributes.Title: Multiples & Improvisations
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Art Studio
280MU
Mount Holyoke College
This class explores Artist's Books in the widest sense, creating one of a kind and edition-able works of art. Book structures and traditional and digital printmaking methods that work well together will be taught. Students will be encouraged to experiment and combine new and old methods of printing and presentation, which may extend to installation. We will consider how choices in sequence, structure, and the interaction of text and image influence the way content is perceived. As we consider haptic and spatial possibilities for reading, looking, and navigating the space of the page, we will look at a wide range of artists working with or nodding to the book form.
Prereq: Art Studio 256.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
91430

attributes.Title: Advanced Studio
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
390
Mount Holyoke College
Concentration on individual artistic development. Emphasis will be placed on experimentation, thematic development, and critical review. Students may elect to take this course more than once.
This course is limited to Art Studio majors only.; Prereq: Four 200-level studio art courses.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
94890

attributes.Title: Drawing for Set & Costume Desg
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Art Studio
226SC
Mount Holyoke College
This course is an investigation into the fundamentals of drawing for costume and set design, with illustration of visual ideas as the focus.  Topics will include figure drawing, garment, fabric, and texture rendering for the purposes of costume design, and scale and perspective drawing of objects and environments for set design.  Various media will be explored including pencil, paint, and mixed media collage.
Prereq: Theatre Arts 122 or Art Studio 120 or Art Studio 116.
Lab fee of $50 for materials to be retained by student.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
91579,91637
91637

attributes.Title: Painting I
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
236
Mount Holyoke College
An introduction to the basic pictorial issues of color and composition in painting.
Prereq: Art Studio 120 or Art Studio 116.
2 studios (2 hours 30 minutes each). Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
94877

attributes.Title: Senior Studio
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
395SS
Mount Holyoke College
Limited to Mount Holyoke Art Studio majors in their senior year
Students enrolled in all studio courses will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
94891

attributes.Title: Drawing I: Visual Exploration
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
120VE
Mount Holyoke College
An introduction to both the technical and conceptual aspects of drawing as a primary tool for visual expression and analysis. Art historical contexts as well as the dialogue between the arts and other disciplines will be considered. Emphasis is placed on learning to see, and to think visually.
Students preregistering for this course must attend the first class meeting of the semester or their names will be dropped from the class roster. Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
94865

attributes.Title: Printmaking/Digital Hybrid
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
226DH
Mount Holyoke College
This course will explore several ways by which to integrate digital techniques with printmaking by hand. Using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, students will incorporate digital methods to develop their imagery but ultimately will print their final work using traditional processes. Students will learn the basics of each technique before moving onto those using digital intervention. Processes will include using photo emulsion for screen printing, digitally cut vinyl as an acid resist for intaglio and laser-printed pronto plates for lithography.
Prereq: Art Studio 116 or Art Studio 120.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95475

attributes.Title: Intro to Technical Theatre
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
137TC
Mount Holyoke College
Course meets in the Rooke Theatre Scene Shop. lab; purchase of design supplies, materials, and theatre tickets is the responsibility of the student
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95602,95451
95602

attributes.Title: Thinking Through Paper and Ink
attributes.Description:
Fall
2014
Art Studio
280TH
Mount Holyoke College
This class explores the intersection of two mediums, paper and print. As the first layer in a print project, the papermaking process will be treated as an opportunity to embed content and imagery while creating a support for additional print work. Students will learn to make various types of paper that fit with the ideas they want to express in the finished print. Printmaking techniques may include screenprinting, intaglio, and relief. Projects may include editioned prints, artists books, and unique images. Students should have prior experience with either papermaking or printmaking.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
89667

attributes.Title: Independent Study
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
295
Mount Holyoke College
1.00-4.00 credits.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
95695

attributes.Title: Costumes Beyond Clothing
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
226BC
Mount Holyoke College
Lab fee $60.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
95608,95568
95608

attributes.Title: Body and Space
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Art Studio
266
Mount Holyoke College
This course focuses on the issues surrounding body and space through installation, performance, and public arts.  Students explore the possibilities of body as an energetic instrument, while investigating the connotations of various spaces as visual vocabulary.  The self becomes the reservoir for expression.  The course examines the transformational qualities of the body as the conduit that links conceptual and physical properties of materials and ideas.
Course limited to sophomores, juniors and seniors
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
93237

attributes.Title: Senior Practicum
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Art Studio
396
Mount Holyoke College
Senior Practicum functions as a capstone course that prepares students to present their artwork formally in the professional world. The course emphasizes the development of presentation skills through group critiques. Students will also be acquainted with procedures for application and admission to residency, internship, and graduate programs. The practicum may include how to document artwork through photography, build a digital portfolio/website, give presentations, write artist's statements, and pursue professional opportunities in art.
Limited to Mount Holyoke Art Studio majors in their senior year
This course is required of all senior majors in studio art.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
91642

attributes.Title: Observation & Abstraction
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Art Studio
280BV
Mount Holyoke College
In class we will work from the figure, the landscape, and masterworks/appropriated imagery. Students will be asked to approach these subjects using relatively unfamiliar painterly methods, hopefully opening new avenues to explore within their work. Students will be asked to further elaborate upon discoveries made in class through independent work, while continuing to consider issues such as scale, surface, mark, space, and light. A particular emphasis will be placed on examining how students' paintings relate to other historical and contemporary artists who employ abstraction in their own work.
Prereq: Art Studio 116 or 120.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
91638

attributes.Title: Independent Study
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
395
Mount Holyoke College
1.00-8.00 credits. Senior studio majors may elect to become candidates for an honors thesis with approval of the studio faculty. NOTE: Students enrolled in all studio courses will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
96308

attributes.Title: Sculpture I
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
246
Mount Holyoke College
Introduction to fundamental sculptural techniques and three-dimensional thinking. Various media are explored, with an emphasis on understanding the language of sculpture through material.
Prereq: Art Studio 120 or Art Studio 116.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
94887

attributes.Title: Painting II: Visual Investig.
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
237VS
Mount Holyoke College
Further study, with emphasis on color and compositional problems and a concentration on personal development. The course employs individual and group critiques to further discussion of contemporary problems in painting.
Prereq: Art Studio 236.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
94893

attributes.Title: Digital Photography I
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
221
Mount Holyoke College
This course explores the basics of photography using digital technologies with emphasis placed on three objectives: first, the acquisition of photographic skills, including composition, digital capture, scanning, Photoshop, and printing; second, an introduction to contexts, such as historical, critical, theoretical, and contemporary movements in photography to advance visual literacy; third, the deepening and expanding of a personal way of seeing. Students will have directed and self-initiated shooting and printing assignments. Slide lectures, readings, and short writing assignments will complement the practical aspects of the course.
Prereq: Art Studio 116 or Art Studio 120.
Students interested in taking this course should possess a digital SLR or an advanced compact camera. Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
94875

attributes.Title: 5C Adv. Sem: The Word on Art
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Art Studio
392WA
Mount Holyoke College
What lies at the intersection of language and art? In this studio course, students will look at contemporary and historical artwork, exhibitions, and theory that highlight this question with the aim of gaining a clearer understanding of how language functions in their personal practice. This may include the discussion and creation of two- and three-dimensional works that incorporates text or letterform, art that is inspired by a specific text, and writings on art. Additionally, we will discuss the role of critique for artists and approaches students can take in talking about their work.
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
93594

attributes.Title: Printmaking I
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Art Studio
256
Mount Holyoke College
Prereq: Art Studio 120 or 116.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
94888

attributes.Title: Japanese Papermaking
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Art Studio
269
Mount Holyoke College
In this course, students learn the traditional practice and history of Japanese hand papermaking, while exploring contemporary applications of the method.  Thin, translucent, strong paper is great for drawing and printmaking, as well as sculptural construction and paper casting.  This fluidity of medium naturally encourages students to become interdisciplinary in their art making.  The apparent fragility, structural strength, and surprising longevity of the material provides a foundation for philosophical investigations into the nature of creativity.
Prereq: Art Studio 120 or 116, and 4 credits of 200-lvl Art Studio.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
91431

attributes.Title: Sculpture II
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Art Studio
247
Mount Holyoke College
Sculpture II is a course offered to continue those concepts and skills introduced in Sculpture I.  This course is designed as a more in-depth experience for the student artist who is interested in the making of three-dimensional form, the construction of space, and the understanding of traditional or contemporary ideas of sculpture.  Various contemporary methods will be examined including site specific art, performance art, installation art, and collaborative works.
Prereq: ARTST-116 or 120, and ARTST-246.
Students enrolled in this course will be responsible for some of the cost of course materials.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
91428
